inlineContent.text: , let’s look at working with Peripheral.
Peripheral provides a write and receive interface to communicate with the viDoc device.
To work with viDoc functions, the first step is to initialize the connection with CBPeripheral. It is mandatory to call the
method after connecting to the peripheral device.
Note: this procedure was described in
Waiting for a response is necessary to ensure that the peripheral device can be used correctly.

code: // You can send requests and read

inlineContent.text: Particular attention should be paid to the process of configuring viDoc after connecting to it.
The flow chart of the configuration process looks like this:

Immediately after connecting to viDoc, its configuration begins (Status = configuration in progress). If you send any command to viDoc during the configuration process, it will be ignored. (Status = device is busy). After the successful completion of the configuration process, you can work with the device. (Status = done)
All state cases are described in
In most cases the configuration should be successful, provided you are using an authorized SDK and viDoc with official software.
How to set up a custom configuration is described in more detail in the
Error descriptions can be found in
A detailed description of the errors can be found in the
The current configuration state can be tracked using the publisher’s
If you want to watch for the current device log, change the debug parameter:
After this, the RTK (NMEA), SATELLITE, NTRIP processes log will appear in the console
Note: Don’t forget to set it back to false when distributing the app.
You can subscribe to the following Peripheral Device publishers:
received from the peripheral. To provide an optimal use of the VigramSDK, the viDoc should be configured to send out NMEA-0183-GGA and NMEA-0183-GST messages.
The serial number of current RTK device (e.g. viDoc 123456)
The type of current RTK device
message containing information of connected RTK device
Information includes the type of device (viDoc / viDoc Light), type of mount, case and other data

This publisher is aggregative (it contains a lot of information: battery, software version and many other information). You can subscribe to this publisher to have one universal publisher, instead of returning data from each request separately.

This publisher is aggregative (it contains a lot of information: сurrent changing of rate value, dynamic state and many other information). You can subscribe to this publisher to have one universal publisher, instead of returning data from each request separately.
Debug messages generated in various delegate methods. The debug messages do not necessarily conform to a specific schema and should only be used during debugging.
This publisher refers to the state of a connected device at the CoreBluetooth abstraction level.
The bluetooth peripheral associated with the viDoc.
message contains information on peripheral configuration state.
messsage containt GNTXT Messages state of viDoc
This publisher is needed to check the state after the viDoc reset command. This process is described in detail in the section
messsage containt state of reset process viDoc
This variable containt information on ppk measurements state. If value true - current mode is UBX-RXM measurements or false - GNSS mode
This process is described in detail in the section
Note: How to work with publishers is described in
The following requests can be sent to Peripheral
Requests the version of the viDoc, including hardware and software version information.
Requests the battery level of the viDoc.

code: // do something with battery charge value

inlineContent.text: GNSS constellation is geodata received from satellites (e.g. GPS, GLONASS, etc.)
Note: Disabling any GNSS constellations significantly reduces the accuracy of measurements
Enable/Disable of GNSS Constellation to selected satellite.
Note: You can turn off individual constellations, except GPS. It is always on
- Messages containing acknowledged or not acknowledge current set request
Activate GNSS Constellation for all satellite.
- Messages containing acknowledged or not acknowledge current set request
Note: by default all are activated
A more detailed description is presented in the section on
- Messages containing acknowledged or not acknowledge current set request
A more detailed description is presented in the section on
- Messages containing acknowledged or not acknowledge current set request
Get minimum Elevation for Satellites currently used in navigation
Elevation value for Filter GNSS Constel lation system currently using in navigation
Elevation value for Filter GNSS Constel lation system currently using in navigation
- Messages containing acknowledged or not acknowledge current set request
Get changing rate of navigation message
This is the value (in Hertz) that determines the update rate of the data in viDoc that is sent to the SDK (response rate). The minimum value is 1Hz, the maximum is 10Hz. The default value is 7Hz.
Set changing rate of navigation message
This is the value (in Hertz) that determines the update rate of the data in viDoc that is sent to the SDK (response rate). The minimum value is 1Hz, the maximum is 10Hz. The default value is 7Hz.
- Messages containing acknowledged or not acknowledge current set request
Measurement mode. You can choose one of types: pedestrian or stationary.

The Pedestrian mode indicates that the object is moving at a typical walking speed, optimizing navigation algorithms for smoother and slower motion. The Stationary mode signifies that the object is completely motionless, allowing systems to reduce noise and conserve resources.
Note: The measurement accuracy in stationary mode is higher.
Measurement mode. You can choose one of types: pedestrian or stationary.

The Pedestrian mode indicates that the object is moving at a typical walking speed, optimizing navigation algorithms for smoother and slower motion. The Stationary mode signifies that the object is completely motionless, allowing systems to reduce noise and conserve resources.
Note: The measurement accuracy in stationary mode is higher.
- Pedestrian or Stationary type of dynamic state
- Messages containing acknowledged or not acknowledge current set request
This process is described in detail in the section

Note: UBX-RXM PPK (Post-Processed Kinematic) measurements are raw GNSS data used for post-processing to achieve centimeter-level positioning accuracy. They include carrier phase, pseudorange, and other satellite data, enabling precise trajectory calculations for applications like surveying, drones, and autonomous systems.
– activate: Bool - activate / disactivate PPK mode
- Messages containing acknowledged or not acknowledge current set request
This process is described in detail in the section
Method is starting record RXM messages to ubx file
– url: URL - The url to store the ubx file.
Note: The method is applicable only for the active mode of PPK measurements
